source_sentence: 第八門第九子攝頌之餘說(妙花婆羅門事)爾時世尊作如是念：「此樹生摩納婆遍於我身欲觀三十二相，已見三十於二有疑，陰、舌二相未能得見。
translation: After the eighth entry and the ninth son's verse, the Bhagavān then had this thought, "This tree-born manabha wanted to look at the thirty-two marks of my body, but after seeing thirty, he had doubts about two, and he couldn't see the marks of the aggregates and tongue.

source_sentence: 我今方便現陰藏相令彼見已。」
translation: Now, I'll skillfully show them the shape of the aggregates so that they'll see them."

source_sentence: 即舒舌相，長至髮際廣覆面門，彼既見已作如是念：「沙門喬答摩眾相具足，有二種業：在俗作輪王；出家成正覺，乃至名聞無不周遍。」
translation: He then stretched out the tongue, extending it to the ends of his hair and covering his face, and after he saw it, he thought, "The ascetic Gautama is replete with many characteristics and has two kinds of karma: he's a conventional wheel-turning king, he's a renunciant and has become perfectly enlightened, and his reputation and learning are not impermeable."

source_sentence: 時摩納婆生大歡喜辭佛而去。
translation: Śākyamuni then left the Buddha with great joy.

source_sentence: 于時妙花婆羅門於一園中，與諸耆宿言話而坐，企望樹生。
translation: At the time, the Marvelous Flower Brāhmaṇa was sitting in a garden, talking with senior citizens, and looking out for the tree growing.

source_sentence: 爾時樹生遙見妙花。
translation: The tree then gave rise to a distant vision of the marvelous flower.

source_sentence: 即便往就敬禮其足及餘尊宿，在一面坐。
translation: He quickly went over to him, paid homage to his feet and the other elders, and sat down at one side.

source_sentence: 妙花告曰：「摩納婆！
translation: The Sublime Flower told him, "Māṇava!

source_sentence: 彼喬答摩有善名稱充遍十方，具諸相好，其事實不？」
translation: Is it true that Gautama has good names that pervade the ten directions and are endowed with various characteristics?"

source_sentence: 答言：「大師！
translation: He replied, "Great teacher!

source_sentence: 眾所稱揚其事皆實，汝頗與彼為言論不？」
translation: All the things that are said about them are true; will you not speak with them?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「共語。
translation: They replied, "They're talking together.

source_sentence: 汝於彼處所有言論，悉皆次第向我陳說。」
translation: All of the things you say there have been explained to me in order."

source_sentence: 時摩納婆於世尊處，所有言論具白妙花。
translation: It was then that Manabha went to the Bhagavān and explained everything he had said to him in white and with a wonderful flower.

source_sentence: 彼既聞已發大瞋恚，即便舉足蹋彼頭上，怒云：「大好使人能辦其事，亦令我身沈淪惡道，如汝共彼言論之時所有差失，彼即引我亦在過中。
translation: After hearing this, he became very angry and even lifted his foot and smashed it on his head, angrily saying, "A great accomplice could have done that, but it would have caused me to sink into a bad path.

source_sentence: 但為日晡不獲即往恭敬問訊，待至明日我當自去。」
translation: Why don't you go there in the afternoon and respectfully inquire after he doesn't get there, and then tomorrow I'll leave on my own?"

source_sentence: 即於夜中備辦種種上妙飲食，纔至晨朝以車運載，詣世尊所到已歡喜，共申言問在一面坐，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: He prepared a variety of excellent foods and drinks during the night and carried them in his chariot until the morning, rejoiced when he arrived at the Bhagavān's place, asked questions together, sat to one side, and said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我為喬答摩辦清淨食已載至此，唯願慈悲哀憐納受。」
translation: I've prepared a pure meal for Gautama and have brought it here, so please have mercy and compassion and accept it."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀於世尊後執扇招涼，佛告阿難陀曰：「汝今可告於此聚落所有苾芻，皆令集在常食堂中。」
translation: Ananta then held a fan behind the Bhagavān and beckoned him to cool off. The Buddha told Ananta, "Now, you may tell all the monks in this village to gather in the common food hall."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀既往告已，悉皆集在常食堂中，即還白佛：「諸人盡集，願佛知時。」
translation: After Ananta had been told in the past that they were all assembled in the permanent dining hall, he returned to the Buddha and said, "All of you are assembled, may the Buddha know when."

source_sentence: 世尊往彼就座而坐。
translation: The Bhagavān went over there, took his seat, and sat down.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門見佛僧眾悉皆坐已，即以自手持妙飲食供養佛僧，大眾食竟嚼齒木洗手已屏收鉢器，便取小席於佛前坐聽說法要。
translation: When the Brāhmaṇas saw the Buddhist community all sitting, they offered the Buddha and Saṃgha a wonderful meal in their own hands. After they had finished eating, they chewed their teeth and washed their hands, put away their bowls, and then took a small seat in front of the Buddha to sit and listen to the teaching of the essentials.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊受婆羅門所設飲食，唱隨喜已說伽他曰：「祭祀火為最，　　初頌論中最，　人中王為最，　　眾流海為最，　眾星月為最，　　光中日為最，　十方世界中，　　凡聖佛為最。
translation: After accepting the meal prepared by the Brāhmaṇa, the Bhagavān then said, "Fire is the greatest sacrifice, fire is the greatest in the first verse, fire is the greatest among humans, the king is the greatest, the ocean of many currents is the greatest, the stars and moon are the greatest, the sun is the greatest among lights, and the worlds in the ten directions are filled with the most noble buddhas.

source_sentence: 所為布施者，　　必獲其義利，　若為樂故施，　　後必得安樂。」
translation: Those who give will surely receive their benefits, and if they give for pleasure, they'll surely attain well-being later."

source_sentence: 爾時眾中有一莫訶羅苾芻，聞佛說此伽他之時，食雖飽足尚咬乾餅作大音聲。
translation: At the time, there was a monk named Mahārāja among the multitude who, when he heard the Buddha speak about this kāṣāya, made a loud noise even though he had enough to eat and was still biting into dry bread.

source_sentence: 婆羅門見而白佛言：「喬答摩聲聞弟子依教行不？」
translation: Seeing this, the Brāhmaṇa said to the Buddha, "Does the śrāvaka disciple of Gautama practice according to the teaching?"

source_sentence: 佛告婆羅門：「有依、不依。」
translation: The Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa, "There are supporters and non-supporters."

source_sentence: 「喬答摩！
translation: "Gautama!

source_sentence: 我今觀此，有樂法者、有貪食者。
translation: Now, I've looked at this, and there are those who enjoy the Dharma and those who crave food.

source_sentence: 喬答摩！
translation: Gautama!

source_sentence: 我有弟子名曰樹生，來至佛所共言論不？」
translation: Do I have a disciple named Jusei who comes to the Buddha and talks with him?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「彼來略共言論。」
translation: The Buddha said, "They've come to share a few words."

source_sentence: 「喬答摩！
translation: "Gautama!

source_sentence: 共彼所有問答談論，幸當為我廣說其事。」
translation: Share with them all the questions, answers, and discussions, and you'll be kind enough to explain them in detail for me."

source_sentence: 佛即次第為說。
translation: The Buddha then explained them in order.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門白佛言：「喬答摩！
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then said to the Buddha, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 其樹生者，無識寡聞心懷高慢，不生畏敬輕觸尊顏，唯願慈悲見容其過。」
translation: That tree grows up with a mind lacking consciousness and few ears that's arrogant, doesn't show reverence, and despises the venerable's face; let's hope that compassionate views will allow it to go awry."

source_sentence: 佛告婆羅門：「我已容恕。」
translation: The Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa, "I've already forgiven it."

source_sentence: 時婆羅門復白佛言：「喬答摩！
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then again said to the Buddha, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 我乘車時、或控馬轡、或舉鞭大喝，當爾之時，願表知我婆羅門妙花頂禮佛足，并問少病少惱起居輕利氣力安不？」
translation: When I ride in my chariot, when I control my horse's handle, or when I raise my whip and shout, may I express my desire to know that my brāhmaṇa, the marvelous flower, salutes the Buddha's feet and asks, "Is it safe to live with little illness and little distress and to have light energy?"

source_sentence: 又白佛言：「喬答摩！
translation: He also said to the Buddha, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 若復見我涉路而行、或脫革屣、或時避道、或時舒臂，當爾之時，如前表知我申敬問。」
translation: If you see me again wading along the road, or taking off my leather sandals, or avoiding the road at times, or stretching my arms at times, then you'll know that I'm asking respectfully, just as I said before."

source_sentence: 又白言：「喬答摩！
translation: He also said, "Gautama!

source_sentence: 或時見我在自眾中共人談說，若移坐處或去上衣或除頂帽，當爾之時，如前表知我申敬問。
translation: Sometimes they see me talking with someone in their congregation, and if they move from their seat or remove their upper robe or cap, they know as before that I'm asking respectful questions.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 喬答摩！
translation: Gautama!

source_sentence: 我婆羅門法唯求名稱，所有衣食受用資具皆從名稱之所獲得，故我於此善護眾人。」
translation: My brāhmaṇa's teaching seeks only fame, and all the necessities for clothing, food, and shelter are obtained by naming them, so here I am, well-protecting all of them."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊作如是念：「此婆羅門極大高慢，我今宜可息彼慢心為其說法。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān had this thought, "This Brāhmaṇa is extremely arrogant, so now I should calm his arrogance and teach for him."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊即為宣暢示教利喜，如佛世尊於尋常時說法之事，謂說布施或說持戒，五欲少味多諸過惡，煩惱染污沈淪生死，清淨涅槃當求出離，如是等法廣為陳說。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān declared, taught, and benefited the joyful, just as the Bhagavān explained the Dharma in ordinary times, which is to say that he taught generosity, precepts, the five desires, few flavors, many faults, the defilement of affliction, sinking into birth-and-death, and the pursuit of escape from pure nirvāṇa, and explained such things in detail.

source_sentence: 世尊知彼欣樂隨喜，發清淨心堪為法器，於殊勝事能得受持。
translation: The Bhagavān knows that they're delighted and follow along, arouse a pure mind, and become a vessel for the Dharma, and are able to uphold these extraordinary things.

source_sentence: 復為廣說苦集滅道四聖諦法，譬如淨衣易受染色。
translation: He also explained in detail the teaching of the four noble truths of suffering, arising, cessation, and the path, which is like a pure robe that's easy to dye.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門即於座上，證見諦理無復疑惑得預流果。
translation: From his seat, the Brāhmaṇa then realized the truths, had no more doubts, and attained the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 即從座起偏露右肩，前禮佛足作如是語：「我今出離，歸佛法僧受五學處，願證知我是鄔波索迦具清淨念。」
translation: He rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, saluted the Buddha's feet, and said, "Now, I've left and returned to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha to accept the five places of training, in the hope of realizing that I am upāsaka with pure mindfulness."

source_sentence: 禮佛足已奉辭而去。
translation: After bowing his head to the Buddha's feet, he said goodbye and departed.

source_sentence: 佛作是念：「彼婆羅門善為譏笑，由老苾芻說施頌時喫食不止，是故不應此時噉食。」
translation: The Buddha had this thought, "That Brāhmaṇa is so ridiculous that he doesn't stop eating when the old monk says a verse, so he shouldn't eat at this time."

source_sentence: 告諸苾芻曰：「彼婆羅門善為譏笑，由莫訶羅說施頌時，喫食不住致斯譏醜。
translation: He told the monks, "That Brāhmaṇa is so ridiculous that he doesn't stop eating when Mahārāja preaches alms, which makes him ridiculous.

source_sentence: 若有苾芻說施頌時，食不住者得越法罪。」
translation: If a monk doesn't eat while expounding verses, he'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 如佛所制說頌之時不應食者，彼不敢食，遂令行末不食時過，佛言：「若有苾芻說施頌時，不聞說聲、不解其義者應食無犯。
translation: According to the Buddha's rule that people shouldn't eat when he preaches hymns, they don't dare to eat, so they make it a mistake to go to the end of the practice when they don't eat. The Buddha says, "If a monk doesn't hear the sound of a preacher's verse and doesn't understand its meaning when he preaches it, he should eat without transgression.

source_sentence: 設若聞聲，不解義者食亦無犯。
translation: If he hears the sound and doesn't understand its meaning, it's also no offense to eat.

source_sentence: 聞聲解義食者越法罪。」
translation: Eating after hearing the sound and understanding its meaning would be a transgression of the Dharma."

source_sentence: 如佛所制聞聲解義不得食者，於一住處眾坐人多，遂使末行屈來至上，彼聞施頌並皆不食日時遂過，佛言：「此若聞聲兼解義者且不應食，待說兩三頌訖，後食無過。」
translation: According to the Buddha's regulations, a person who hears sounds and understands their meaning shouldn't eat. When there are many people sitting in a dwelling place, they cause the mendicant to come up to the top, and when they hear the verses and don't eat, the day passes, and the Buddha says, "Suppose this person hears sounds and understands their meaning and doesn't eat, but waits until he finishes speaking two or three verses and then eats without fault."

source_sentence: 佛在婆羅痆斯仙人墮處施鹿林中，爾時世尊於小食時，著衣持鉢入城乞食。
translation: When the Buddha was in the Deer Preserve in Vārāṇasī, the Bhagavān put on his robe and took his bowl into the city to solicit alms during the midday meal.

source_sentence: 有餘苾芻亦行乞食，至一園中佇立而住，見諸男女起惡尋思作邪欲念。
translation: Some other monks who were also begging for food went to a park, stood up, and saw men and women who were engaged in harsh discursive thoughts and mistaken desires.

source_sentence: 佛見苾芻知作邪念不善相應，遂近其處告言苾芻：「苾芻！
translation: Seeing that the monk knew that wrong thoughts were not well concomitant with evil, the Buddha approached the monk and told him, "Monks!

source_sentence: 汝於自身，下苦種子流出臭糞，蠅蟲不食無有是處。」
translation: In yourself, you're sowing bitter seeds that ooze smelly dung, and there's nowhere that flies won't eat them."

source_sentence: 彼既聞已作如是念：「世尊今者知我邪心。」
translation: After hearing this, they thought, "The Bhagavān now knows that I have a wrong mind."

source_sentence: 即大驚怖身毛皆竪，便出園中。
translation: They were terrified, their hair stood on end, and they left the garden.

source_sentence: 佛作是念：「苾芻非處而停住時有如是過。」
translation: The Buddha then thought, "This is the kind of mistake a monk makes when he stops at a place that's not his own."

source_sentence: 即乞食已還至本處，飯食訖收衣鉢洗足已入房宴坐。
translation: After soliciting alms, he returned to his original place, put away his robe and bowl after finishing his meal, washed his feet, and retired to his room to sit down.

source_sentence: 於日晡時從定而起，於僧眾中就座而坐，告諸苾芻曰：「我向入城為欲乞食，見一苾芻亦為乞食至一園中，起惡尋思作欲邪念。
translation: In the late afternoon, he rose from his meditation, took his seat among the saṃgha, and sat down. He told the monks, "I went into town to solicit alms, and I saw a monk who had also gone to a park to solicit alms and had given rise to bad thoughts of investigation and desire.

source_sentence: 我知彼人作斯惡念，便就其邊而告彼曰：『苾芻苾芻！
translation: Knowing that person's evil thoughts, I went to his side and told him, 'Monks! Monks!

source_sentence: 汝於自身下苦種子臭糞流出，蠅蟲不食無有是處。』
translation: There's no place for you to put down bitter seeds in yourself that stink of excrement and aren't eaten by flies and worms.'

source_sentence: 彼既聞已作如是念：『世尊今者知我邪心。』
translation: After hearing this, he thought, 'The Bhagavān now knows that I have a wrong mind.'

source_sentence: 即大驚怖身毛皆竪，遂出園中。
translation: He was terrified, and his hair stood on end, so he left the garden.

source_sentence: 是故苾芻不應非處而為住立。
translation: Therefore, a monk shouldn't stand up in a place that's not his.

source_sentence: 若住立者得越法罪。」
translation: If they stand, they'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 有一苾芻聞佛說已，即從座起頂禮雙足，白言：「世尊大德！
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, a monk rose from his seat, bowed his head with both feet, and said, "Bhagavān, great sir!

source_sentence: 於聖教中，何者名為苦惡種子？
translation: Among the noble teachings, what is called the seeds of suffering and evil?

source_sentence: 何謂臭糞流出蠅蟲皆食？」
translation: What is meant by smelly dung that flows out and is eaten by flies and worms?"

source_sentence: 佛言：「苾芻！
translation: The Buddha said, "Bengku!

source_sentence: 苦種子者，謂是三種罪惡不善邪思量法。
translation: "Seeds of suffering are three kinds of sinful, unwholesome, and wrongly conceived dharmas.

source_sentence: 云何為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 謂惡欲尋思、瞋恚尋思、殺害尋思。
translation: It's the contemplation of bad desires, the contemplation of anger, and the contemplation of killing.

source_sentence: 臭糞流出者，臭糞謂是五欲：色、聲、香、味、觸。
translation: Smelly excrement flows out, and smelly excrement refers to the five desires: form, sound, odor, taste, and touch.

source_sentence: 流出者，謂欲纏心，以其六根追求六境流動不住。
translation: What flows out is a mind tethered by desire, which doesn't stop moving because its six faculties pursue the six objects.

source_sentence: 蠅蟲者，謂諸世間於六觸處無心制止，起貪瞋等憂悲苦惱作罪惡業。」
translation: A fly is a worldly being who doesn't have the mind to stop the six sense-fields, which gives rise to craving, anger, and other grief, sorrow, pain, and vexation that create bad karma."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊復說頌曰：「不攝眼耳等，　　被欲之所牽；　苦子種身中，　　臭氣常流出。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke another verse, "Uncontained eyes and ears and so forth are pulled by desire, and in the body of a bitter child, a stench always flows out.

source_sentence: 若在於聚落，　　或居閑靜處；　常於日夜中，　　不思於正法。
translation: If they're in a village or live in a quiet place, they'll spend their days and nights not thinking about the right teaching.

source_sentence: 由依罪惡念，　　遂起妄尋思；　遠離樂住緣，　　當受於苦報。
translation: Relying on sinful and evil thoughts, they then engage in false discursive thought; far from the conditions of pleasant abiding, they'll experience the results of suffering.

source_sentence: 若人修寂定，　　於勝慧勤行；　常得安隱眠，　　不被蠅蟲惱。
translation: If someone cultivates tranquil concentration and diligently practices superior wisdom, they'll always sleep in comfort and won't be bothered by flies and insects.

source_sentence: 親近於善友，　　勝人之所說；　若能如是學，　　更不受當生。」
translation: He becomes close to a good friend and is taught by a superior person; if he can train in this way, he'll no longer be subject to future birth."

source_sentence: 如世尊說：苾芻不應非處住立者，不知何者名為非處？
translation: As the Bhagavān said, 'A monk shouldn't stand in a wrong place,' but I wonder what's called a wrong place?

source_sentence: 佛言：「非處有五：唱令家、婬女家、沽酒家、王家、旃荼羅家，是謂五處非所行境。」
translation: The Buddha said, "There are five wrong places: the house of a singer, the house of a promiscuous woman, the house of a seller, the house of a king, and the house of a candra; these are the five places that are not objects of practice."

source_sentence: 第八門第十子攝頌曰：　由蛇觀臥具，　　一衣不為禮，　初至寺中時，　　老年應禮四。
translation: The eighth entry, the tenth son, recites this verse: "Because he observes the snake's bedding, he doesn't pay homage to a single garment when he first arrives at the temple, but he should pay homage to four elderly people.

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城。
translation: The occasion was in the city of Silla Vista.

source_sentence: 時有苾芻欲去遊行，所有臥具於親友處囑令看守。
translation: A monk who wanted to leave for a parade had his bedding placed with a friend or relative and asked him to guard it.

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻即以臥物安置舊處而不受用，時有毒蛇來求住處，遂於褥下蟠屈而居。
translation: That monk then put his bedding in his old place and didn't use it. A viper then came looking for a place to stay, so it coiled up under his mat and stayed there.

source_sentence: 有客苾芻來投此而住，暫停歇已行禮佛塔，及餘苾芻日暮歸房。
translation: A guest monk came and stayed here, paid homage to the stūpa after taking a short rest, and the other monks returned to their room at sunset.

source_sentence: 舊住苾芻告言：「具壽！
translation: The monk who was staying there before told him, "Gosu!

source_sentence: 此是水土燈油先敷臥具，行來疲困洗足安眠。」
translation: This is the kind of oil and water that lanterns first put on your bedding, so you can wash your feet and sleep soundly when you're tired from walking."

source_sentence: 由先業力不觀臥具，遂即眠睡壓著其蛇，蛇從褥出便螫苾芻，苾芻受苦宛轉蛇上，於片時間二俱命斷。
translation: Because of his prior karmic effort and failure to examine his bedding, he then falls asleep and presses up against a snake, which emerges from his mat and stings the monk. The monk suffers pain and turns around on the snake, and in a moment's time their lives are both cut short.

source_sentence: 至天曉已主人來喚，彼既身死無復祗承，主人念曰：「行來疲極且縱安眠，睡足之後自當起覺。」
translation: When the master comes to call him after sunrise, he says, "He's been traveling and is exhausted; let him sleep soundly; he'll get up after he's had enough sleep."

source_sentence: 食時欲至更來打門，喚言：「可起，食時欲至。」
translation: When it's time for food, he comes to the door again and calls, "You may get up; it's time for food."

source_sentence: 既無響應，即取戶鑰開入房中，見其身亡，次翻臥褥復見蛇死。
translation: When there was no response, he took the door key, opened it, went into the room, and saw his body dead.

source_sentence: 眾共來看知被蛇螫，以緣白佛，佛作是念：「不觀臥具因致俱亡。」
translation: The people came together to see that they knew they'd been stung by a snake, and they brought it to the Buddha's attention. The Buddha had this thought, "Not observing the bedding causes them to die together."

source_sentence: 告諸苾芻曰：「受他囑者應將臥具付知事人，或可隨時自為曬曝，置於架上繫不令墮。
translation: He told the monks, "Suppose someone who's been instructed by another person to entrust their bedding to someone who knows, or perhaps they can dry it themselves at any time and place it on a shelf so that it won't fall down.

source_sentence: 若欲眠時應須觀察。」
translation: If you want to sleep, you must examine it."

source_sentence: 彼於夜分燈火照看。
translation: At night, he lights a lamp and looks at it.

source_sentence: 佛言：「不應如是，可於白日豫為觀察。」
translation: The Buddha said, "That shouldn't be the case; you can observe it later in the day."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻無問新舊悉皆翻轉，佛言：「舊者應觀，莫翻新者，有襯褥布時時抖擻，不爾得越法罪。」
translation: The monks then all turned over the old and new without question, and the Buddha said, "You should observe the old and not the new, or you should shake out the mattress cloths when you have them; otherwise, you'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma."

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城。
translation: It was in the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 有二苾芻同房而住，時一苾芻度一少年弟子，弟子多睡久而方覺，師每訶責。
translation: There were two monks living in the same room. At the time, one monk had a young disciple who often slept for a long time before he awoke, and the master always scolded him.

source_sentence: 後欲天明忽然驚起，但披僧脚敧往詣師所，其師正起欲著下裙。
translation: Later, when he wanted to suddenly rise at dawn, he put on his monk's robe and went to the master's office, where he was about to put on his undergarment.

source_sentence: 弟子近前禮足而起，既新剃髮戴起師裙在頭上住，弟子所披亦便墜墮，師弟二人悉皆形露。
translation: When the disciple approached him and got up with his feet bowed, he put on the master's skirt with his freshly shaven hair on top of his head, and the robe the disciple had worn fell off, revealing both the master and disciple.

source_sentence: 彼苾芻見報言：「具壽！
translation: That monk saw and reported, "Kauśāmbī!

source_sentence: 我今善知汝等皆是丈夫男根具足。」
translation: Now, I well know that all of you are fully endowed with the male faculty of a husband."

source_sentence: 時彼二人各懷羞恥默爾而去，其師遂即訶責弟子，餘苾芻問：「汝有何過常被師瞋。」
translation: When they both withdrew in shame and silence, their teacher reprimanded the disciple, and the other monk asked, "What was your fault in always being angered by your teacher?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「昔瞋有緣，今時無過，師徒義絕，我今行矣！」
translation: They replied, "In the past, anger had its causes, but now it's no fault; the teacher and his disciple have cut off their righteousness, and now I've done it!"

source_sentence: 復問何事？
translation: What was the question again?

source_sentence: 即具告知，報言：「具壽！
translation: He immediately informed them in full, saying, "Gosshou!

source_sentence: 汝誠有過，訶責合宜。」
translation: You are truly at fault, and it's appropriate to rebuke you."

source_sentence: 聞便默爾。
translation: They heard this and remained silent.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛念其師訶成順法，告諸苾芻：「從今已後，不得著一衣禮他，亦不得一衣受禮，違者得越法罪。」
translation: The monks then told the Buddha by way of example, and the Buddha, mindful that their teacher had reprimanded them for conforming to the teaching, told the monks, "From now on, you mustn't wear a single garment to worship others, and you mustn't accept a single garment as homage; to do otherwise would be a violation of the teaching."

source_sentence: 緣在王舍城，如世尊言：「於他苾芻，不相體悉不為解勞。」
translation: It was in Rājagṛha that the Bhagavān said, "A monk who doesn't share anything with another monk doesn't understand his trouble."

source_sentence: 時有眾多苾芻從異方來禮制底，竟無一人為解疲極，猶如被擯隨處而住，或在簷前、或居門屋、或在樹下。
translation: It happened that a large number of monks came from different places to pay homage to Cedi, but none of them were so exhausted that they were like being rejected and living anywhere, whether in front of a canopy, in a doorway, or under a tree.

source_sentence: 時有信心婆羅門居士等，見已問言：「聖者！
translation: When some faithful Brāhmaṇas and others saw them, they asked, "Sage!

source_sentence: 何緣被擯隨處而住？」
translation: What are the reasons for being rejected and living anywhere?"

source_sentence: 報言：「賢首！
translation: He replied, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 我非被擯，是客新來。」
translation: I wasn't expelled; I'm a new visitor."

source_sentence: 婆羅門曰：「若爾，何不住在房內？」
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "If that's the case, why don't you stay in your room?"

source_sentence: 「我無故識，誰復相容？
translation: "Who would be compatible with a consciousness that has no cause in me?

source_sentence: 為禮聖蹤暫來至此，隨處停住不久當還。」
translation: He came here temporarily to pay homage to the traces of the sages, and he'll return soon after stopping here."

source_sentence: 諸人聞說皆生嫌恥：「我等曾聞沙門釋子性懷平等，何處得有平等之行？
translation: When the people heard this, they all became disgusted, "We've heard that the ascetic Śākyamuni is equal in nature; where could he have practiced equality?

source_sentence: 見同梵行客人創來而不容止。」
translation: When they see guests who are engaged in the same religious practice come, they won't allow them to stop."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛告諸苾芻：「從今已去，凡是客僧來入寺者，先應禮拜耆宿四人當前而立，主應好心准法安置。」
translation: The monks then told the Buddha about this, and he told the monks, "From now on, whenever a guest monk comes to enter the temple, he or she should first venerate the four elders standing in front of him or her, and the host should kindly follow the rules and place them there."

source_sentence: 後於異時，有客苾芻遊行人間，時將欲暮至王舍城，先知佛制禮老年者，即問諸苾芻曰：「尊者阿若憍陳如今在何處？」
translation: At another time, a guest monk wandering among the people was about to arrive in Rājagṛha at sunset when he realized that the Buddha had made it a rule to pay homage to elderly people, and he asked the monks, "Venerable Ājñāta-Kauṇḍinya, where is he now?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「在竹林園中。」
translation: He answered, "In the bamboo grove."

source_sentence: 便即就彼扣門而喚，時尊者憍陳如問言：「是誰？」
translation: He then went there, buttoned the door, and called out to Venerable Kauṇḍinya, who then asked, "Who is it?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「我是客僧。」
translation: He answered, "I'm a visiting monk."

source_sentence: 尊者喚入令其歇息。
translation: The venerable monk summoned him in and told him to take a rest.

source_sentence: 客僧問言：「尊者大迦葉今在何處？」
translation: The visiting monk asked, "Venerable Mahākāśyapa, where is he now?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「具壽！
translation: He replied, "Kusum!

source_sentence: 彼在畢鉢羅窟。」
translation: They're in the cave of Pippalāyāna."

source_sentence: 于時客僧如言往彼如前通問，尊者喚入安慰停息客僧。
translation: The visiting monks then went there as instructed and asked the same questions as before, and the venerable summoned them in to comfort and calm the visiting monks.

source_sentence: 即問：「尊者准陀今在何處？」
translation: He then asked, "Venerable Cunda, where is he now?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「彼在鷲峰山。」
translation: He replied, "They're on Vulture Peak."

source_sentence: 客僧便往致問，尊者命入如前令息。
translation: The visiting monk then went to ask about it, and the venerable ordered him to enter as before and tell him to stop.

source_sentence: 客僧問曰：「尊者十力迦葉今在何處？」
translation: The visiting monk asked, "Venerable Śāriputra Kāśyapa, where are they now?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「今在細儞迦窟。」
translation: He answered, "Now, I'm at the cave of Sainika."

source_sentence: 客僧便去既見尊者，同前問答令其止息。
translation: The visiting monk then went away and met the venerable, asking the same question and telling him to stop.

source_sentence: 客僧答言：「今已天明，當須乞食不可更留。」
translation: The visiting monk replied, "It's dawn, and I must beg for food; I mustn't stay any longer."

source_sentence: 作如是語：「如世尊言：『客僧到處先令禮拜四耆宿。』
translation: He said, "Just as the Bhagavān said, 'The guest monk must first pay homage to the four elders when he arrives.'

source_sentence: 者，此是方便治罰客人不令安隱。」
translation: This is a way to punish the guests and prevent them from being comfortable."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻以緣白佛，佛言：「我先豈令客苾芻禮大地尊宿，唯遣禮謁當處老宿四人。」
translation: The monks then brought the matter to the Buddha's attention, and he said, "Did I first order the guest monks to pay homage to the venerable elder, but only to send them to pay homage to the four elders in the monastery?"

source_sentence: 內攝頌曰：　世尊為高勝，　　廣說弟子行，　行雨問大師，　　為說七六法。
translation: An internal verse says, "The Bhagavān is so distinguished that he explains in detail the disciples' practice, asks the teacher about the rows and rains, and explains seven or six teachings.

source_sentence: 緣在室羅伐城。
translation: He was in the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時具壽高勝於晡後時，從定而起往詣佛所，禮雙足已退坐一面，請世尊曰：「弟子事師所有行法，唯願為說。」
translation: In the late afternoon, Kauśāmbī rose from his meditation, went to the Buddha, saluted his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and asked the Bhagavān, "Please explain to me all the things that my disciples do in service to the teacher."

source_sentence: 佛告高勝：「我今為說苾芻所有弟子門人供事之法，汝應諦聽。
translation: The Buddha told Kōshō, "Now, I'm going to explain to you, Bhagavān, the teaching that disciples, disciples, and followers should serve, so listen closely.

source_sentence: 凡為弟子，於師主處常懷恭敬有畏懼心，不為名聞、不求利養，當須早起親問二師：『四大安隱、起居輕利。』
translation: Whenever a disciple approaches a master, he should always be respectful and fearful, not seeking fame or profit, and should get up early and ask the two masters, 'The four elements are peaceful, and rising and soaring is light.'

source_sentence: 除小便器為按摩身，其師若言：『我今有疾。』
translation: Remove the urinal and massage your body, and if your teacher says, 'Now I'm sick,' then ask what's wrong with you and go to the doctor.

source_sentence: 應問所患，便往醫處具說病由、請方救療，如醫所教便為療治。
translation: You should ask what's wrong, then go to the doctor, explain the cause of the illness, request a prescription, and treat it just as the doctor has taught you.

source_sentence: 若師自有藥物應用和合，如其無者可問近親。
translation: If the teacher has his own medicine to apply and mix, then he can ask a close relative if he doesn't have one.

source_sentence: 親眷若多應問師曰：『何親處求？』
translation: If there are many relatives, you should ask the teacher, 'Where will they ask for help?'

source_sentence: 得師教已如言可去。
translation: After he receives the teacher's teaching, he can leave as he's been told.

source_sentence: 若無親族，應向餘家如教往覓，或詣病坊施樂之處。
translation: If he doesn't have any relatives, he should go to another family as he's been taught, or he might go to a place where he's sick and gives joy to people.

source_sentence: 此若無者當緣自業，於飲食中而為將息。
translation: If he doesn't have any of these, he should take care of his own business and work on his food and drink to calm it down.

source_sentence: 若病可時授以齒木，其師欲嚼齒木之處，應先淨掃作曼荼羅，安置坐枯及盛水瓶器，并澡豆土屑淨齒木刮舌篦。
translation: If he's given tooth wood when he's well enough, his teacher should first cleanse and make a maṇḍala at the place where he wants to chew the wood, place a sitting duck and a vase full of water, and wash the beans and dirt to clean the wood, scrape the tongue, and pick it up.

source_sentence: 既澡漱已除所須物。
translation: After he's washed and rinsed them, he removes what's needed.

source_sentence: 若師患目，應問醫人，為作眼藥而塗拭之。
translation: If the teacher has eyes trouble, he should ask a doctor to prepare eye medication and wipe it.

source_sentence: 次應授衣，餘衣襞疊勿使撩亂。
translation: Next, he should confer his robe, and don't let the rest of his robes be folded up and distorted.

source_sentence: 師禮塔時，當入房中灑掃其地，若有塵土，應將牛糞或以青葉而揩拭之。
translation: When the teacher pays homage to the stūpa, he should go into his room and sweep the floor; if there's any dust, he should wipe it with cow dung or green leaves.

source_sentence: 次應自禮尊儀及禮師主，或問安白事，於日日中三時禮拜，當隨己力於同梵行者亦申禮敬。
translation: Next, he should pay homage to the venerable and worship the master, or ask about the peace offering, venerate him three times a day at midday, and follow his own example by paying homage to those who practice the same religion.

source_sentence: 次應策勤坐禪讀誦，每於半月須觀曬床席。
translation: Next, he should diligently sit in meditation and recite, and every half month he should observe the sun drying his bed and seat.

source_sentence: 若至食時應洗兩鉢。
translation: When it's time to eat, he should wash his two bowls.

source_sentence: 若是乞食苾芻，自持重鉢、輕者與師。
translation: If you're a monk begging for food, you must carry your own heavy bowl or give the lighter one to your teacher.

source_sentence: 若在寒時，以重僧伽胝與師令著，自持輕者。
translation: If it's cold, he'll give the teacher the heavy bowl and make him put it on, and then he'll take the lighter one himself.

source_sentence: 若於熱時，輕者與師、自持重者。
translation: If it's hot, he'll give the lighter one to the teacher and carry the heavy one himself.

source_sentence: 若逆風行，請師在前、自身在後。
translation: If he's traveling against the wind, he asks the teacher to go before him and asks himself to go after him.

source_sentence: 若順風行，自身在前，令師在後。
translation: If he's walking with the wind, he puts himself in front and tells his teacher to stay behind him.

source_sentence: 若渡河水扶侍令過。
translation: If he's crossing a river, he'll help his attendant to get him across.

source_sentence: 若乞食時應問師主，為當同行為當別去？
translation: When you're begging for food, you should ask the master whether you should go with him or leave him alone.

source_sentence: 若言同行即可隨去。
translation: If they say they'll go along, they can leave.

source_sentence: 若得乾麨、豆餅及酸漿水，置己鉢中；若得米、乳酪、石蜜、飯餅及沙糖，安師鉢內。
translation: If he finds dry rice, cheese, rock honey, rice crackers, and sugar, he puts them in his teacher's bowl.

source_sentence: 乞得食已還至本處，作二小壇布以諸葉，可安二座踞坐飯食。
translation: After you've begged for food, you return to your original place, build two small altars, spread out leaves, and sit down to eat from your two seats.

source_sentence: 若別行者，所乞得食將呈師主：『今得此食須者應取。』
translation: If someone else is practicing, they'll present the food they've begged to the master, saying, 'Now, you should take this food if you need it.'

source_sentence: 師主即應知量而受。
translation: The master then should accept it, knowing its worth.

source_sentence: 若住寺者，弟子應先洗器，往至厨中問知事人：『今為僧伽作何飲食？』
translation: If he's staying at the temple, the disciple should first wash his utensils and go to the kitchen and ask the person in charge, 'What food is being prepared for the saṃgha?'

source_sentence: 其知事人敬而告知，彼還白師：『今日僧伽作如是食。
translation: The person in charge of the monk's office respectfully informed him, and he returned to the master, saying, 'Today, the saṃgha is making this kind of food.

source_sentence: 可請取不？』
translation: May I ask to take it?'

source_sentence: 依教持來，師應知量觀時而受。
translation: "According to the teaching, the teacher should know the amount and examine the time to accept it.

source_sentence: 若其二師澡漱之處，應淨掃除作曼荼羅，安坐床子及以水器，并土齒木如法揩洗。
translation: If the two masters wash their place, they should cleanse it and make a maṇḍala, install a seat and water vessel, and wipe off the dirt and teeth and wood according to the rules.

source_sentence: 若須洗足應為師洗，或但用水，或可塗油以屑揩去，更將水洗當授皮履，問其食事。
translation: If you need to wash your feet, you should wash them for the teacher, either with water or with oil and shavings, and then wash them with water when you're given leather footwear, asking about their food.

source_sentence: 又問：『為於此處修習善業？
translation: He also asks, 'Is this a place to cultivate good behavior?'

source_sentence: 為復向餘閑靜住處？』
translation: Why should I go to another quiet dwelling place?"

source_sentence: 若言：『可向晝日住處。』
translation: "If someone says, 'You can go to your daytime residence.'

source_sentence: 者，應持坐物，其所住處掃灑清淨，於時時間牛糞塗拭。
translation: then you should take a sitting cloth, sweep and clean the place where you're staying, and rub it with cow dung at the appropriate time.

source_sentence: 若學讀者應為授經、若學禪思教其作意。
translation: If you're a student reader, you should teach them the sūtras and if they're a student of meditation, you should teach them how to contemplate.

source_sentence: 若還來時應觀床席，自洗足已次禮尊像及同梵行者，隨力而禮，與師置座同前洗足。
translation: When he returns, he should look at his bed and seat, wash his own feet, then venerate the image of the venerable and fellow practitioners of Buddhism, pay homage according to his ability, and place his seat with his teacher and wash his feet together.

source_sentence: 若是寒時，應守持心為暖湯水。
translation: When it's cold, he should guard his mind and warm the water with hot water.

source_sentence: 若是熱時，應可持扇而為招涼。
translation: When it's hot, he should hold a fan to invoke coolness.

source_sentence: 師亦知時，令其作業，勿使空度。
translation: The teacher also knows the time and tells him to work, so he doesn't let himself be idle.

source_sentence: 若衣鉢等營作之時，所有事業皆師物在前，次營己物。」
translation: When it's time to work on the clothing and bowls, the teacher's things should come first, followed by his own."

source_sentence: 佛言：「高勝！
translation: The Buddha said, "Kōshō!

source_sentence: 汝今應知，諸苾芻眾所有弟子門人，供給二師如父母想。
translation: Now, you should know that all the Bhikṣu's disciples and followers make offerings to the two teachers as if they were their parents.

source_sentence: 師於弟子當如子想，若有病患共相瞻侍至差至死。
translation: A teacher should think of his disciple as a son, and if he's ill, they should look after each other until they're sick and die.

source_sentence: 我今為汝略說其事，應如是作。
translation: Now, I'll explain this briefly for you, and you should do so.

source_sentence: 若不依者，隨於其事皆得越法罪。
translation: If you don't follow them, whatever they are, you'll be guilty of transgressing the Dharma.

source_sentence: 若能如是，弟子於師以敬順心為供侍者，能令善法相續不絕，譬如蓮花處在池中日夜增長。
translation: If he can do so, a disciple who serves his teacher with respect and deference will be able to cause good qualities to continue uninterrupted, like a lotus flower growing day and night in a pond.

source_sentence: 是故汝等當如是學。」
translation: Therefore, you must train yourselves in this way."

source_sentence: 時具壽高勝及諸苾芻，聞佛說已歡喜奉行。
translation: Kauśāmbī and the monks who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.

source_sentence: 緣在王舍城，住鷲峯山。
translation: They stayed at Vulture Peak, which is in the city of Rājagṛha, for a while.

source_sentence: 時摩揭陀主未生怨王，與佛栗氏國共相違逆，未生怨王於大眾中告諸人曰：「安隱豐樂與我相違，我欲興兵而往討罰皆令破散。」
translation: When the lord of Magadha, the king of unborn enemies, and the king of the Buddhas were in common disagreement, the king of unborn enemies told the people in the crowd, "Our peace and prosperity are at odds with me, and I want to raise an army to punish them and scatter them."

source_sentence: 王告大臣行雨婆羅門言：「卿往佛所頂禮佛足，為我問訊起居輕利，少病少惱氣力安不？
translation: The king told the minister, Xing Yu Bolamen, "Would you go to the Buddha and bow at his feet, inquire for me about the lightness of his appearance and well-being, and the safety of his vitality with few illnesses and few disturbances?

source_sentence: 次復白言：『大德！
translation: Next, he said, 'Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 未生怨王對諸眾前作如是語：「彼國豐樂與我相違，我欲興兵而往討罰皆令破散。」
translation: The king of the unborn enemies said this to the crowd, "That country's abundance and happiness are contrary to mine, and I want to raise an army to punish them and scatter them."

source_sentence: 世尊許不？』
translation: Does the Bhagavān permit it?"

source_sentence: 如世尊記，皆當領受還來報我。
translation: As the Bhagavān remembers, they'll all receive and return to me.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 如來、應、正遍知者言無虛妄。」
translation: The words of the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Perfectly Omniscient One are not false."

source_sentence: 是時行雨奉王教已，乘白馬車執持金杖，掛以金瓶出王舍城，往詣佛所。
translation: After he had received the king's teaching, Hayagrī left Rājagṛha in a white horse-drawn chariot, carrying a gold staff and a gold vase, and went to visit the Buddha.

source_sentence: 至下車處，足步而行登鷲峰山，至世尊所歡顏敬問，在一面坐白言：「世尊！
translation: When he got off the chariot, he walked up Vulture Peak on foot, went to the Bhagavān, beamed with joy and respect, sat down at one side, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 摩揭陀主未生怨王，頂禮世尊足下，敬問起居輕利，少病少惱氣力安不？」
translation: The lord of Magadha, the unborn king of enemies, paid homage at the feet of the Bhagavān, respectfully asking, "Is it easy to get up and live, and is your vitality comfortable with few illnesses and few disturbances?"

source_sentence: 作是語已，佛告婆羅門：「願王及汝無病安樂。」
translation: After he said this, the Buddha addressed the Brāhmaṇa, "May the king and you be without illness and in well-being."

source_sentence: 時婆羅門即以王語，次第白佛廣陳其事：「未審世尊作何垂誨？」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then said to the Buddha, in turn, in the words of the king, and explained the matter in detail, "What guidance has the Bhagavān not yet given?"

source_sentence: 佛告婆羅門：「我不多時在佛栗氏國，曾於三月坐夏之時於彼而住，我時為眾宣說七種不退轉法。
translation: The Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa, "Not long ago, I was staying in the land of Buddhaṛṣi during the summer retreat in March, and I taught seven kinds of irreversibility for the crowd.

source_sentence: 婆羅門！
translation: Brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 彼國諸人護持七種不退法時，國界人民日見增長善法無損。」
translation: When the people of that country maintain the seven kinds of irreversibility, the people of that country see a daily increase in good qualities that aren't diminished."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「我未能解大德所陳要妙之義，唯願慈悲廣為我說令得開解。」
translation: The Brāhmaṇa said, "I'm unable to understand the essential and subtle points that the great virtuous one has presented, so please have mercy and explain them to me so that I can understand them."

source_sentence: 爾時具壽阿難陀在佛後立執扇招涼，佛告阿難陀：「汝頗聞知佛栗氏國所有人民，數多聚集評論法義不？」
translation: It was then that Kauṣṭhila Ānanda stood behind the Buddha holding a fan and beckoning him to cool off, and the Buddha addressed Ānanda, "Have you heard that you know of the many people of the Buddha's country who gather to comment on the meaning of the Dharma?"

source_sentence: 「大德！
translation: "Great virtue!

source_sentence: 我聞彼國人多聚集評論法義。」
translation: I've heard that many people in that country gather to discuss the meaning of the Dharma."

source_sentence: 佛告婆羅門：「若彼國中人多聚集評論法義，應知彼國日見增長善法無損(一了)。
translation: The Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa, "If people in that country often gather to discuss the meaning of the Dharma, you should know that every day that country sees the growth of good qualities without loss.

source_sentence: 阿難陀！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝頗聞知佛栗氏國，人多和合同起同坐評論國事？」
translation: Have you heard that in the land of the Kuru, many people rise up in agreement and sit together to discuss the affairs of the land?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我聞。」
translation: He replied, "I've heard it."

source_sentence: 廣說如上，佛告婆羅門亦具如上說，乃至善法無損(二了)。
translation: Explaining it in detail as above, the Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa that it was also as explained above, even up to the point where the good qualities aren't harmed (both fully).

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝頗聞知彼國人眾，不應求事而不求之，所應得事不令斷絕，國之教令常樂奉行？」
translation: Have you heard that the people of that country don't seek things that shouldn't be sought, don't cut off things that should be obtained, and are instructed by the country to always delight in their practice?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我聞。」
translation: He replied, "I've heard it."

source_sentence: 廣說如上，佛告婆羅門亦具如上說，乃至善法無損(三了)。
translation: Explaining it in detail as above, the Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa that it was also as explained above, up to the point where the good qualities aren't harmed (triple confession).

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝頗聞知彼國女人及童女類，或是母護父護兄弟姊妹姑嫜親族，而相擁護有過訓罰，是他妻妾乃至授花許為其婦，不共倉卒行非法事？」
translation: Have you heard that women and girls in that country are either mothers who protect fathers, brothers, sisters, aunts, and relatives, and defend each other with a wrongful admonition, or are their wives and concubines or even given flowers as permission to be their wives, and don't act unlawfully together in haste?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我聞。」
translation: He replied, "I've heard it."

source_sentence: 廣說如上，佛告婆羅門亦具如上說，乃至善法無損(四了)。
translation: Explaining it in detail as above, the Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa that it was also as explained above, up to the point where the good qualities aren't harmed (four comprehensions).

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝頗聞知彼國人眾，於其父母師長之處，恭敬供養隨順言教情無違惱？」
translation: Have you heard that the people of that country respectfully serve and obey their parents, teachers, and teachers without being disobstructed by words?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我聞。」
translation: They replied, "I've heard it."

source_sentence: 廣說如上。
translation: It's explained in detail as above.

source_sentence: 佛告婆羅門亦具如上說，乃至善法無損(五了)。
translation: The Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa that he had also explained as above, up to the point where the good qualities aren't harmed (five comprehensions).

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝頗聞知彼國人眾，於制底處常修供養，所有古舊恭敬法式不令虧廢？」
translation: Have you heard that the people of that country always cultivate offerings in restrained places, and that they don't let their old ways of veneration go unused?"

source_sentence: 廣說乃至善法無損(六了)。
translation: They explain it in detail ... until the good qualities are not harmed (six comprehensions).

source_sentence: 「阿難陀！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝頗聞知彼國人眾，於阿羅漢敬心慇重常生正念，其未來者願皆來此，其已來者得安隱住，衣服飲食臥具醫藥，所須資具皆悉給與無有乏少。」
translation: You will have heard that the people of that country are so respectful and respectful of the arhat that they always give rise to right mindfulness, that those who will come will wish to come here, and that those who have come will be given peaceful lodging, clothing, food, bedding, medicine, and all the necessities that they need without fail."

source_sentence: 廣說乃至善法無損(七了)。
translation: It's explained in detail, up to the point where the good qualities aren't harmed (seven times).

source_sentence: 佛告婆羅門：「但令彼國所有人眾，於斯七種不退轉法修行之時，當知彼國常得增長，無有損失善法隆盛。」
translation: The Buddha told the Brāhmaṇa, "When all the people of that country cultivate these seven kinds of irreversibility, they will know that their country will always grow and that there will be no loss as the good Dharma prospers."

source_sentence: 婆羅門言：「大德！
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 彼國人眾於七法中隨行其一，未生怨王不應興罰，何況七法具足奉行。」
translation: If the people of that country follow one of these seven rules, the king of enemies who has yet to arise won't punish them, much less fully practice all seven rules."

source_sentence: 婆羅門曰：「大德喬答摩！
translation: The brāhmaṇa said, "Mañjuśrī Gautama!

source_sentence: 我有多緣且欲辭去。」
translation: I have many conditions and I want to leave."

source_sentence: 佛言：「隨意。」
translation: The Buddha said, "As you wish."

source_sentence: 時婆羅門聞佛所說歡喜奉行。
translation: The Brāhmaṇa then heard what the Buddha taught and rejoiced and approved.

source_sentence: 時婆羅門辭佛去後，佛告阿難陀：「汝可遍告鷲峯山處所有苾芻，皆令集在供侍堂中。」
translation: After the Brāhmaṇa left the Buddha, the Buddha told Ānanda, "You may tell all the monks on Vulture Peak to gather in the service hall."

source_sentence: 時阿難陀即便遍告諸苾芻眾盡集堂已，還至佛所，在一面立白言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda then rushed back to the Buddha after telling all the monks to gather in the hall, stood to one side, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 苾芻盡集，願佛知時。」
translation: When the bhikṣus have gathered, may the Buddha know."

source_sentence: 佛至堂所就座坐已，告諸苾芻：「我今為汝說七不虧損法，汝等諦聽極善作意。
translation: After he had taken his seat in the hall, the Buddha addressed the monks, "Now, I'm going to explain seven things to you that aren't harmful, and you must listen closely and pay very good attention to them.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 數多集會評論法義，應知苾芻福德增長善法無損(一了)。
translation: Gathering repeatedly to discuss the meaning of the teaching, you should know that the virtues of the monks will increase, and the good qualities will not be diminished (once understood).

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若和合同集，同起同坐同作法事，應知福德增長善法無損(二了)。
translation: If they gather together in harmony and perform the rituals while rising and sitting together, they should know that their virtue will increase and their good qualities won't be harmed (both clear).

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 不應求者而勿苦求，所應得者不令斷絕，所有正教常樂奉行，如是當知福德增長善法無損(三了)。
translation: Not suffering for what shouldn't be sought, not cutting off what should be obtained, and always delighting in the practice of all right teachings, you should know that virtue grows and good qualities are not diminished (three times understood).

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 所有愛著與貪俱生，喜願未來諸有相續，由此輪轉；此若除者，如是當知得安樂住，令諸苾芻福德增長善法無損(四了)。
translation: "All attachments and cravings that arise together with joy and desire for the continuity of future existence are thus revolving; if this is removed, you will thus know that you can live in well-being, which will cause the virtues of the monks to increase and the good qualities to not decrease (four understandings).

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若有苾芻久事出家，修淨梵行滿二十夏，耆年宿德大師所讚，為同梵行者之所識知，眾皆恭敬殷重供養，所說言教樂共聽聞，如是當知福德增長善法無損(五了)。
translation: If a monk leaves home after a long career, cultivates a pure religious practice for 20 summers, is praised by senior veterans and veteran masters, is known by those who practice the same religion, is respected and venerated by all, and is glad to hear the words and teachings spoken, then he will know that his virtue has grown and that the good qualities have not been diminished (five understandings).

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若有苾芻居阿蘭若，受下臥具生喜足心，如是當知福德增長善法無損(六了)。
translation: "If a monk lives in a forest and accepts the bedding below and becomes contented, this should be known as a way to increase virtue and not harm good qualities (six comprehensions).

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若有苾芻，於同梵行者殷重用心常存正念，欲令不來同梵行者而來至此，既來至已作安樂住心不生厭，於新衣服飲食臥具醫藥所須資具，皆悉給與勿令少乏，廣說乃至善法無損(七了)。
translation: "Suppose there are monks who are earnestly devoted to those who practice the same celibacy and always maintain right mindfulness, who want those who don't practice the same celibacy to come here, who make themselves comfortable once they arrive, who don't become disillusioned at heart, who give new clothing, food, bedding, and the necessary provisions for medicine, who don't let them be lacking, and who explain extensively even the good qualities without harming them (seven of them).

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 能行如是七種法時，當知苾芻所有善法常得增長，無有虧損安樂而住。
translation: When you can practice these seven things, you should know that a monk's good qualities will always grow, and he'll live in well-being without any loss.

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 復有七種不虧損法，汝等應聽。
translation: "There are seven other things that aren't harmful, which you should listen to.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 若諸苾芻於大師處，恭敬供養尊重讚歎，如是作時得安樂住，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損(一了)。
translation: "If the monks respectfully offer support, honor, and praise the teacher's presence, and when they thus do so, they attain a comfortable abiding, which will enable the monks and nuns to develop good qualities without harming them (once understood).

source_sentence: 如是應知，於法、於戒、於教授事、不放逸事、於臥具事、於修定事，生殷重心恭敬供養，如是作時得安樂住，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損(七了)。
translation: Thus, you should know that when you make serious, respectful offerings to the Dharma, precepts, matters of instruction, matters of non-carelessness, matters of bedding, and matters of cultivated concentration, you attain a comfortable abiding while thus doing, which will enable the multitude of monks to grow the good Dharma without harm (7. Understand).

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 復有七種不虧損法，汝等應聽。
translation: "There are seven other things that aren't harmful, which you should listen to.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 若諸苾芻不愛作業、不愛言談、不著睡眠、不樂聚集及近惡友、不貪名利參問他人、常修於定，於增上證不生喜足無退屈心，乃至證得真實諦來無暫休息，如是作時得安樂住，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損(七了)。
translation: If monks don't crave work, don't like talk, don't get attached to sleep, don't enjoy gathering around bad friends, don't crave fame and profit, don't question others, and always cultivate concentration, they don't become satisfied with the enhanced realization and don't retrogress, until they realize the true truth and come to rest without a moment's pause, and when they do so, they attain a comfortable abode that causes the multitude of monks to grow in good qualities without harm (seven comprehensions).

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 復有七種不虧損法，汝等應聽。
translation: "There are seven other things that aren't harmful, which you should listen to.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 若有苾芻有淨信心、有慚有愧、具大精勤、有念定慧，如是作時得安樂住，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損(七了)。
translation: If a monk has pure faith, conscience, modesty, great diligence, and mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom, he'll attain a comfortable abode when he does so, so that the multitude of monks will be able to increase the good Dharma without harm (seven comprehensions).

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 復有七種不虧損法，汝等應聽。
translation: "There are seven other things that aren't harmful, which you should listen to.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 知法知義、知時知量、知自身、知門徒、知他人行，如是作時得安樂住，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損(七了)。
translation: Knowing the teaching and knowing its meaning, knowing the time and knowing its measure, knowing yourself, knowing your disciples, and knowing the actions of others, they attain a comfortable abode when they do so, which causes the multitude of monks to develop the good Dharma without harm (seven comprehensions).

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 復有七法。
translation: "There are another seven things.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 若有苾芻修念覺分觀時，依空閑處依止離欲、依止寂滅遠離災難，如是法勤喜安定捨；修觀之時依空閑處、依止離欲、依止寂滅遠離災難，如是作時得安樂住，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損。
translation: "If there are monks who cultivate the awakening factor of mindfulness, rely on the quiet place, rely on seclusion from desire, rely on tranquility, and abstain from calamity, and thus diligently rejoice and stabilize equanimity; when they cultivate their contemplation, they rely on the quiet place, rely on seclusion from desire, and rely on tranquility and abstain from calamity, and when they thus work, they attain a peaceful abode that enables the monks and nuns to increase the good qualities without harm.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 是謂七法，無有退轉應常修習，汝等一心慇懃守護，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損。
translation: These are the seven things that are irreversible and should always be cultivated, which you should single-mindedly and diligently guard so that the multitude of monks may grow in the good Dharma without harm.

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 復有六法令他歡喜，汝應諦聽！
translation: There are six other things that cause others to rejoice, so listen closely!

source_sentence: 我當為說。
translation: "I will explain this for you.

source_sentence: 云何為六？
translation: What are the six?

source_sentence: 一者我今應以身業行慈，謂於大師所及諸賢聖同梵行處，起慈善心以身禮敬，灑掃塗拭作曼荼羅，布列眾華燒香供養，或復為其按摩手足，若見病苦隨時供給。
translation: "One, I should now practice kindness with my physical actions, which is to say that I should go to the place where the great teacher and the good sages are practicing their religion together, be charitable and venerable with my body, make a maṇḍala by sweeping and wiping, spread out flowers and burn incense to make offerings, massage his hands and feet, or make offerings at any time if I see illness or pain.

source_sentence: 如是作時令他歡喜，愛念敬重共相親附，和合攝受無諸違諍，一心同事如水乳合。
translation: When they do so, they make others happy, adore and respect them, become intimate with each other, are collected together without conflict, and work together with one mind like water and milk.

source_sentence: 「二者我今應以語業行慈，謂於大師所及諸賢聖同梵行處起慈善心，以語讚歎彰其實德，他不聞者令其普知，讀誦經典晝夜無歇，如是作時令他歡喜，愛念敬重共相親附，和合攝受無諸違諍，一心同事如水乳合。
translation: "Second, now I should conduct myself with kindness through verbal action, which is to be charitable toward the great teacher and the sages who practice the same celibacy, praise them with words that reveal their true merits, make them generally known to others who haven't heard, recite the sūtras day and night without stopping, and thus cause others to rejoice, remember and honor them with mutual affection, gather them together without conflict, and work with one mind like water and milk coming together.

source_sentence: 「三者我今應以意業行慈，謂於賢聖同梵行處起慈善心，不生妬害慳嫉之想，於身語業所有行慈，繫念思惟無令斷絕。
translation: "Third, I should now practice kindness with my mind's work, which is to be charitable in the place where good people and noble people practice together as priests, not to give rise to thoughts of harm or stinginess, and to practice kindness with regard to my physical and verbal actions, keeping them in mind and reflecting on them without stopping them.

source_sentence: 設在危難，亦不暫停，況復平居而乖正念。
translation: Even in times of danger, they won't pause, so why wouldn't they live in peace and deviate from right mindfulness?

source_sentence: 於諸含識起悲愍心，不斷其命不行楚苦，遠離煩惱至解脫處。
translation: He arouses compassion for the impassioned consciousnesses, doesn't stop with their lives and doesn't inflict pain, and secludes himself from affliction to the point of liberation.

source_sentence: 如是作時令他歡喜，愛念敬重共相親附，和合攝受無諸違諍，一心同事如水乳合。
translation: When they do so, they make others happy, adore and respect them, become intimate with each other, are collected together without conflict, and work together with one mind like water and milk.

source_sentence: 「四者諸有所得如法利養，乃至鉢中獲少飲食，悉皆歡喜共他受用不屏處食，於同梵行者情無彼此。
translation: "Fourth, whatever gains they make are for the benefit of the Dharma, even the small amount of food they get in their bowls, they all rejoice when they share with others what they eat and don't eat in isolation, and their feelings for those who practice the same celibacy are not mutual.

source_sentence: 如是作時令他歡喜，愛念敬重共相親附，和合攝受無諸違諍，一心同事如水乳合。
translation: When they do so, they cause others to rejoice, remember and respect each other, become intimate with each other, are collected together, have no conflicts, and work together with one mind like water and milk coming together.

source_sentence: 「五者於所受戒，不破不穴不雜不垢不穢，初後淨持智人所讚，同梵行者不生輕鄙，共持淨戒法食俱同。
translation: "Five people receive precepts that aren't broken or denigrated, aren't mixed or defiled, are praised by wise men for their initial and subsequent observance, don't despise those who practice the same celibacy, and share the same food and drink with those who observe the pure precepts.

source_sentence: 如是作時令他歡喜，廣說乃至如水乳合。
translation: When they do so, they cause others to rejoice, explaining it in detail up to the point where it's like water and milk coming together.

source_sentence: 「六者能生正見無有疑惑，是聖出離無能破壞速盡苦邊，與同梵行者共同此見。
translation: "Sixth, they can give rise to a right view without doubt, which is noble emancipation that doesn't destroy the limit of suffering quickly, and they share that view with fellow religious practitioners.

source_sentence: 如是作時令他歡喜，廣說乃至如水乳合。
translation: When they do so, they make others rejoice and explain it in detail, even as water and milk come together.

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！
translation: "You monks!

source_sentence: 是謂六種歡喜之法，應常修習慇懃守護，令諸苾芻眾得增長善法無損。」
translation: These are the six joyful qualities that should always be cultivated and guarded with care, so that the multitude of monks and nuns may develop good qualities without harm."

source_sentence: 時諸眾聞佛說已，皆悉歡喜信受奉行。
translation: After hearing what the Buddha taught, the multitude of people rejoiced and believed and approved.

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶雜事卷第三十五
